message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with sentiment classification in natural language text. It could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it proposes a novel approach using graph convolutional networks. Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as it utilizes neural networks for sentiment classification. Finally, it could also be classified under cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as sentiment analysis is often used in information retrieval tasks.
